thread.title: Man killed in Stroud nightclub named
thread.title_full: Man killed in Stroud nightclub named | West Country - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Man killed in Stroud nightclub named
text:
Jack Mitchell who died on Sunday. Credit: Family Photo The man who died after a fight inside a nightclub in Stroud has been named by his family.
Soldier Jack Mitchell was 24 years old - his mum described him as 'the kindest most gentlest man you could eve meet.'
Jack died at the Warehouse Club in Stroud, Gloucestershire in the early hours of Sunday morning.
A 28 year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of murder and remains in police custody.
Jack's mother Kate Mitchell said: "As a mother who today lost a most precious gift through a completely senseless act can I please ask all mothers to hold their children a little bit tighter tonight.
"My son was the kindest most gentlest man you could ever meet. My heart is broken, but if one thing can come out of Jack's death, that will save any other parents from this most excruciating pain, can it be that, before you throw that punch, stop and think what the consequences could be.
"I am so proud of my son and what he achieved. He had his whole life to look forward to.
"Me his Dad, his brother and his sister's, will miss him every single day."
The nightclub was very busy at the time of the assault, which occurred in the upstairs bar of the premises. It is likely that a number of people would have witnessed the incident and I am keen to hear from anyone who has information which can help us with our enquiries. Witnesses are asked to ring 101 and Quote: incident number 39 of 5th February.
â€“ Detective Inspector Jim Taylor Eyewitnesses at the scene said a fight between two men broke out on the top floor of the club. Another man was seen being dragged from the club by security shortly after. Bouncers and police officers then blocked off all exits from the building.
After an announcement was made confusion and panic spread across the dance floor. Clubbers were locked inside for hours while police at the doors took details from everyone. Single-file queues to leave the club were over an hour and a half long. Some weren't able to leave until after 4.30am.
Music was shut down while the DJ gave instructions to those left inside.
All those trapped inside eventually had to leave one by one through a fire exit near the dance floor into a side street.
The entrance to the building has been cordoned off and the windows have been blocked up. Flowers have today been laid at the scene.
Last updated Mon 6 Feb 2017 Stroud Gloucestershire
